str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(Aramaic), riches, money, possessions, property. Of Chaldee origin; mammonas, i.e. Avarice.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
